name: Ace of Swords
description: A single sword rises from a cloud, crowned with victory laurels. It cuts through mist, symbolizing mental clarity, truth, and decisive insight.

name: Two of Swords
description: A blindfolded figure holds crossed swords under the moon, representing blocked emotions and the need to choose with both mind and heart.

name: Three of Swords
description: Three swords pierce a red heart beneath storm clouds, symbolizing sorrow, emotional release, and the pain that brings clarity.

name: Four of Swords
description: A knight lies in stillness beneath a stained-glass window with swords above, symbolizing rest after struggle and renewal of thought.

name: Five of Swords
description: A smirking figure gathers swords while others walk away. The sky darkens, symbolizing hollow victory and the cost of selfish ambition.

name: Six of Swords
description: A boat glides across calm waters with swords set before the passengers, symbolizing mental passage from turmoil to peace.

name: Seven of Swords
description: A figure sneaks from a camp with five swords in hand, looking back warily. It speaks of stealth, trickery, or clever planning.

name: Eight of Swords
description: A blindfolded woman stands bound among eight swords. Though trapped, her bindings are loose — freedom lies in shifting perception.

name: Nine of Swords
description: A figure sits upright in bed beneath nine hanging swords, head in hands, symbolizing worry, sleeplessness, and mental torment.

name: Ten of Swords
description: A fallen figure lies pierced by ten swords beneath a dawn sky, symbolizing painful endings that give rise to new beginnings.

name: Page of Swords
description: A youthful figure stands poised with a sword in the wind, eyes sharp, symbolizing intellect, communication, and fresh thinking.

name: Knight of Swords
description: A knight charges forward beneath stormy clouds, sword raised high, symbolizing determination, haste, and fearless pursuit.

name: Queen of Swords
description: A regal woman sits on a high throne, sword upright, face keen and honest. She symbolizes discernment, reason, and direct truth.

name: King of Swords
description: A king sits with a balanced sword and calm gaze, symbolizing wisdom, justice, and mastery of the intellect.

name: Ace of Swords Reversed
description: The sword droops from its crown, shrouded in fog, symbolizing lost clarity and truth obscured by doubt or fear.

name: Two of Swords Reversed
description: The blindfold falls, the crossed swords lower, symbolizing a choice forced into light and balance disrupted or restored.

name: Three of Swords Reversed
description: The swords slip from the heart, rain clearing, symbolizing emotional release and the mending of old wounds.

name: Four of Swords Reversed
description: The resting figure stirs uneasily beneath suspended swords, symbolizing exhaustion or a refusal to pause and heal.

name: Five of Swords Reversed
description: The victor lowers their weapons, the sky brightens, symbolizing release from conflict and the humility to make peace.

name: Six of Swords Reversed
description: The boat struggles against the current, symbolizing difficulty leaving behind pain or transition delayed.

name: Seven of Swords Reversed
description: The thief turns back, caught in the act, symbolizing accountability and the end of deceit or self-deception.

name: Eight of Swords Reversed
description: The bindings fall away, the woman steps free from the circle of blades, symbolizing liberation and renewed confidence.

name: Nine of Swords Reversed
description: The figure lifts their head as dawn breaks, symbolizing awakening from fear and seeing anxiety lose its hold.

name: Ten of Swords Reversed
description: The figure rises from the ground, the dawn brightening, symbolizing release from pain and a new beginning after ruin.

name: Page of Swords Reversed
description: The youth wields the sword carelessly, wind scattering their focus — ideas misused or words that cut unwisely.

name: Knight of Swords Reversed
description: The horse rears, the knight’s charge becomes reckless, symbolizing rash action and unbridled force without clarity.

name: Queen of Swords Reversed
description: The queen lowers her sword, her gaze hardened, symbolizing emotional distance or harsh judgment clouding reason.

name: King of Swords Reversed
description: The king’s sword tilts, his face stern and cold, symbolizing rigid thinking, unfair authority, or twisted intellect.
